alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 05 at 2:12AM PST until January 05 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TODAY... * WHAT...Breaking waves of 10 to 12 feet with dangerous rip currents. Largest waves on west to northwest facing beaches. * WHERE...Santa Barbara County Central Coast and San Luis Obispo County Central Coast. * WHEN...Until noon PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. High surf combined with high tides may result in minor coastal flooding to beach areas and walkways from 8 AM to noon Tuesday.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast
